61 // Simply stores the command line options
62 typedef struct Options {
63  double T1;
64  double T2;
65  double dT;
66 
67  double P1;
68  double Bg;
69 
70  std::string mixture;
71  std::string boundary_layer_comp;
72  std::string pyrolysis_composition;
73 
74  bool pyrolysis_exist = false;
75 } Options;
76 
77 // Checks if an option is present
78 bool optionExists(int argc, char** argv, const std::string& option) {
79  return (std::find(argv, argv + argc, option) != argv + argc);
80 }
81 
82 // Returns the value associated with a particular option
83 std::string getOption(int argc, char** argv, const std::string& option) {
84  std::string value;
85  char** ptr = std::find(argv, argv + argc, option);
86 
87  if (ptr == argv + argc || ptr + 1 == argv + argc)
88  value = "";
89  else
90  value = *(ptr + 1);
91 
92  return value;
93 }
94 
95 // Prints the program's usage information and exits.
96 void printHelpMessage(const char* const name) {
97  std::string tab(" ");
98 
99  cout.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
100 
101  cout << endl;
102  cout << "Usage: " << name << " [OPTIONS] mixture" << endl;
103  cout << "Compute the non-dimensional mass blowing rate for mixture "
104  << "over a set of temperatures and pressure using the Mutation++ "
105  "library."
106  << endl;
107  cout << endl;
108  cout << tab << "-h, --help prints this help message" << endl;
109  cout << tab
110  << "-T temperature range in K \"T1:dT:T2\" or simply "
111  "T (default = 300:100:5000 K)"
112  << endl;
113  cout << tab << "-P pressure in Pa P (default = 1 atm)"
114  << endl;
115  cout << tab
116  << "-b pyrolysis non-dimensional mass blowing rate "
117  "(default = 0)"
118  << endl;
119  cout << tab << "-m mixture name" << endl;
120  cout << tab << "-bl boundary layer edge composition name"
121  << endl;
122  cout << tab
123  << "-py pyrolysis composition name (default = null)"
124  << endl;
125 
126  cout << endl;
127  cout << "Example:" << endl;
128  cout
129  << tab << name
130  << " -T 300:100:5000 -P 101325 -b 10 -m carbonPhenol -bl BLedge -py Gas"
131  << endl;
132  cout << endl;
133  cout << "Mixture file:" << endl;
134  cout << tab << "carbonPhenol - corresponds to the name of the mixture"
135  << endl;
136  cout << tab
137  << "BLedge - corresponds to the boundary layer edge elemental "
138  "composition"
139  << endl;
140  cout << tab
141  << "Gas - corresponds to the pyrolysis elemental gas composition"
142  << endl;
143  cout << endl;
144 
145  exit(0);
146 }
147 
148 // Parses a temperature or pressure range
149 bool parseRange(const std::string& range, double& x1, double& x2, double& dx) {
150  std::vector<std::string> tokens;
151  String::tokenize(range, tokens, ":");
152 
153  if (!String::isNumeric(tokens)) return false;
154 
155  switch (tokens.size()) {
156  case 1:
157  x1 = atof(tokens[0].c_str());
158  x2 = x1;
159  dx = 1.0;
160  break;
161  case 3:
162  x1 = atof(tokens[0].c_str());
163  x2 = atof(tokens[2].c_str());
164  dx = atof(tokens[1].c_str());
165  break;
166  default:
167  return false;
168  }
169 
170  if (dx == 0.0) {
171  x2 = x1;
172  dx = 1.0;
173  }
174 
175  return true;
176 }
177 
178 bool parseRange(const std::string& range, double& x1) {
179  std::vector<std::string> tokens;
180  String::tokenize(range, tokens, ":");
181 
182  if (!String::isNumeric(tokens)) return false;
183 
184  x1 = atof(tokens[0].c_str());
185 
186  return true;
187 }
188 
189 // Parse the command line options to determine what the user wants to do
190 Options parseOptions(int argc, char** argv) {
191  Options opts;
192 
193  // Print the help message and exit if desired
194  if (argc < 2) printHelpMessage(argv[0]);
195 
196  if (optionExists(argc, argv, "-h") || optionExists(argc, argv, "--help"))
197  printHelpMessage(argv[0]);
198 
199  // Get the temperature range
200  if (optionExists(argc, argv, "-T")) {
201  if (!parseRange(getOption(argc, argv, "-T"), opts.T1, opts.T2,
202  opts.dT)) {
203  cout << "Bad format for temperature range!" << endl;
204  printHelpMessage(argv[0]);
205  }
206  } else {
207  opts.T1 = 300.0;
208  opts.T2 = 15000.0;
209  opts.dT = 100.0;
210  }
211 
212  // Get the pressure range
213  if (optionExists(argc, argv, "-P")) {
214  if (!parseRange(getOption(argc, argv, "-P"), opts.P1)) {
215  cout << "Bad format for pressure !" << endl;
216  printHelpMessage(argv[0]);
217  }
218  } else {
219  opts.P1 = ONEATM;
220  }
221 
222  // Get the pressure range
223  if (optionExists(argc, argv, "-b")) {
224  if (!parseRange(getOption(argc, argv, "-b"), opts.Bg)) {
225  cout << "Bad format for pressure !" << endl;
226  printHelpMessage(argv[0]);
227  }
228  } else {
229  opts.Bg = 0;
230  }
231 
232  if (optionExists(argc, argv, "-m")) {
233  opts.mixture = getOption(argc, argv, "-m");
234  } else {
235  printHelpMessage(argv[0]);
236  }
237 
238  if (optionExists(argc, argv, "-bl")) {
239  opts.boundary_layer_comp = getOption(argc, argv, "-bl");
240  } else {
241  printHelpMessage(argv[0]);
242  }
243 
244  if (optionExists(argc, argv, "-py")) {
245  opts.pyrolysis_composition = getOption(argc, argv, "-py");
246  opts.pyrolysis_exist = true;
247  }
248 
249  return opts;
250 }
251 
252 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
253 #ifdef _GNU_SOURCE
254  feenableexcept(FE_INVALID | FE_DIVBYZERO | FE_OVERFLOW);
255 #endif
256 
257  Options opts = parseOptions(argc, argv);
258 
259  Mixture mix(opts.mixture);
260 
261  const int ne = mix.nElements();
262  const int ns = mix.nSpecies();
263 
264  std::vector<double> Yke(ne, 0);
265  std::vector<double> Ykg(ne, 0);
266  std::vector<double> Xw(ns, 0);
267 
268  // Run conditions
269  double T1 = opts.T1;
270  double T2 = opts.T2;
271  double dt = opts.dT;
272  double P = opts.P1;
273  double Bg = opts.Bg;
274  double Bc, hw;
275 
276  mix.getComposition(opts.boundary_layer_comp, Yke.data(), Composition::MASS);
277 
278  if (opts.pyrolysis_exist)
279  mix.getComposition(opts.pyrolysis_composition, Ykg.data(),
280  Composition::MASS);
281 
282  cout << setw(10) << "\"Tw[K]\"" << setw(15) << "\"B'c\"" << setw(15)
283  << "\"hw[MJ/kg]\"";
284  for (int i = 0; i < ns; ++i)
285  cout << setw(25) << "\"" + mix.speciesName(i) + "\"";
286  cout << endl;
287 
288  for (double T = T1; T < T2 + 1.0e-6; T += dt) {
289  mix.surfaceMassBalance(Yke.data(), Ykg.data(), T, P, Bg, Bc, hw,
290  Xw.data());
291  cout << setw(10) << T << setw(15) << Bc << setw(15) << hw / 1.0e6;
292  for (int i = 0; i < ns; ++i) cout << setw(25) << Xw[i];
293  cout << endl;
294  }
295 }
